p: In addition to tarin, taro contains a mixture of other anti-neoplastic molecules, such as polyphenols and polysaccharides, as mentioned previously [ 125, 126]. An ethanolic extract from freeze-dried taro exhibited an antiproliferative effect against adult T-cells leukemia lineages and, in some of them, effectiveness was superior to the apoptotic effect of genistein, an isoflavone found in soy, which is a popular grain recognized to trigger apoptosis in estrogen-dependent cancers [ 46, 127]. A water-soluble 200 kDa polysaccharide (taro-4-I) composed of neutral sugar and uronic acid isolated from taro crude extract was able to inhibit mice lung colonization by B16BL6 melanoma cells [ 45].
